dict.string: Extensions copyright (c) 2016 by Adam Twardoch. Original copyright for Bitstream Vera Mono: (c) 2003 by Bitstream, Inc. All Rights Reserved.
Original design: Jim Lyles. Extensions: Adam Twardoch

This font is a special version of the Bitstream Vera Mono font, originally designed by Jim Lyles. This version has been extended by Adam Twardoch.
This font is intended for testing of OpenType Layout features support in an application. Using a special test string (see below), the user can selectively turn on and off OpenType features in the application's UI and observe which OpenType feature tags are being applied to the text. All features are of type GSUB LookupType 4 (ligature) and are registered in the Latin (latn) default languagesystem.
"Nadyezhda" is Russian for "Hope". Along with "Vera" (which was also the original name for this typeface, and is Russian for "Faith") and with "Lyubov" ("Love"), they form the three Biblical virtues, and rank among the most popular Russian female given names.
The special test string is:
aa ab ac ad ae af ag ah ai aj ak al am an ao ap aq ar as at au av aw ax ay az ba bb bc bd be bf bg bh bi bj bk bl bm bn bo bp bq br bs bt bu bv bw bx by bz ca cb cc cd ce cf cg ch ci cj ck cl cm cn co cp cq cr cs ct cu cv cw cx cy cz da db dc dd de df dg dh di dj dk dl dm dn do dp dq dr ds dt du dv dw dx dy dz ea eb ec ed ee ef eg eh ei ej ek el em en eo ep eq er es et eu ev ew ex ey ez
Bitstream Vera is a trademark of Bitstream, Inc.
